page.title: 13Ecology
page.content: The majority of the Soulbury area consists of farmland evenly distributed between grazing and crop cultivation. The area towards Heath and Reach becomes sandy and is used by nearby brick manufacturing works. This area contains a large country park named Stockgrove Park with a lake and many lovely walks. There are a large variety of wild mammals in the area including badgers, foxes and Muntjac deer (dog deer). The Whaddon Chase hunt operate regularly in the area. Soulbury has inaugerated an Environment group responsible for preserving existing flora and fauna and to supply new trees, shrubs and bulbs.They aim to restore and return the village to its original environment. The landscape has been devastated by the loss of the elm trees due to Dutch elm disease.
